alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Eastern Box Elder County; Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 2:13PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT WEST CENTRAL WEBER...NORTHWESTERN CACHE AND NORTHEASTERN BOX ELDER COUNTIES... At 212 PM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from near Lewiston to near Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway...and moving southeast at 35 mph. Locations impacted include... Logan, Brigham City, Tremonton, Cache, Smithfield, Hyrum, Perry, Wellsville, Willard, Lewiston, Bear River City, Mantua, Corinne, Clarkston, Trenton, Plymouth, Howell, Benson, Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway, and Utah State University. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 354 and 400. Interstate 84 between mile markers 10 and 42. US Route 89 between mile markers 459 and 465. * winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this squall. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this squall. * sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in this squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
